tit.cmt: カッコ部分を補いました。

sen.j: ダイダラボッチは、日本の各地で伝承される巨人 (伝説の生物)。
sen.e: Daidarabocchi is a giant in Japanese mythology handed down at many parts in Japan. (a creature in legend)
Daidarabocchi is a mythological giant which is handed down in many parts of Japan (a creature in legend).
sen.cmt: ”伝承される巨人”の部分を修正しました。at many parts in→in many parts of, ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: Daidarabocchi is a mythological giant which is handed down in many parts of Japan (a creature in legend).

sen.j: 数多くの類似の名称が存在する。
sen.e: There are many similar names of the giant.
There are many similar names of the giant.
There are many similar names of the giant.

sen.j: このため本稿では便宜的に名称をダイダラボッチとする。
sen.e: Therefore, in this article the name Daidarabocchi will be used for the sake of convenience.
Therefore, in this article the name Daidarabocchi will be used for the sake of convenience.
Therefore, in this article the name Daidarabocchi will be used for the sake of convenience.

sen.j: 山や湖沼を作ったという内容が多いことから、元々は国づくりの神であった可能性が指摘されている。
sen.e: As the legend often has contains the story of the giant building mountains and lakes, it is pointed out that the giant was originally the God of nation building.
As the legend often contains the story of the giant building mountains and lakes, it is pointed out that the giant was originally the god of nation building.
sen.cmt: スペースの修正、has を削除し、God→god と修正しました。
sen.e: As the legend often contains the story of the giant building mountains and lakes, it is pointed out that the giant was originally the god of nation building.

sen.j: 柳田国男は『ダイダラ坊の足跡』（4月中央公論社）で日本各地から集めたダイダラボッチ伝説を考察している。
sen.e: In the book titled "Daidarabo no Ashiato (the foot print of Daidarabocchi)," Kunio YANAGITA studied the legends of Daidarabocchi that he had gathered in many parts of Japan.

In the book titled "Daidarabo no Ashiato" (the foot print of Daidarabocchi) (April issue, Chuo Koronsha), Kunio YANAGITA studied the legends of Daidarabocchi that he had gathered from many parts of Japan.
sen.cmt: クォーツを修正しました。in→from と修正しました。”（4月中央公論社）”を補いました。（ただし、ウェブで確認したところ、これは”4月中央公論社”という出版先のことではなく、”1927年（昭和2年）4月中央公論社”のことであり、このことを踏まえた上で原文のまま補いました）
sen.e: In the book titled "Daidarabo no Ashiato" (the foot print of Daidarabocchi) (April issue, Chuo Koronsha), Kunio YANAGITA studied the legends of Daidarabocchi that he had gathered from many parts of Japan.

sen.j: ダイダラボッチは「大人（おおひと）」を意味する「大太郎」に法師を付加した「大太郎法師」で、一寸法師の反対の意味であるとしている。
sen.e: He wrote in the book that Daidarabocchi comes from 'Daitarohoshi,' which is the combination of 'Daitaro' (ohito or a giant) and hoshi (man), and Daidarabocchi is the counterpart of Issunboshi (The Inch-High Samurai).

He stated in the book that Daidarabocchi comes from 'Daitarohoshi,' which is the combination of 'Daitaro' (ohito or a giant) and hoshi (man), and Daidarabocchi is the counterpart of Issunboshi (The Inch-High Samurai).

He stated in the book that Daidarabocchi comes from 'Daitarohoshi,' which is the combination of 'Daitaro' (ohito or a giant) and hoshi (man), and Daidarabocchi is the counterpart of Issunboshi (The Inch-High Samurai).

sen.j: 「でいだらぼっち」、「だいらんぼう」、「だいだらぼう」、「でいらんぼう」、「だいらぼう」、「だだぼう」等がある。
sen.e: There are different names such as 'Deidarabocchi,' 'Dairaonbo,' 'Daidarabo,' 'Deiranbo,' 'Dairabo' and Dadabo.
There are different names such as 'Deidarabocchi,' 'Dairanbo,' 'Daidarabo,' 'Deiranbo,' 'Dairabo' and 'Dadabo' and so on.
sen.cmt: Dairaonbo→Dairanbo,クォーツ、and so son を挿入しました。
sen.e: There are different names such as 'Deidarabocchi,' 'Dairanbo,' 'Daidarabo,' 'Deiranbo,' 'Dairabo' and 'Dadabo' and so on.

sen.j: 名前以外にも様々な派生が見られる。
sen.e: Besides the names, many derivations are seen.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Besides the names, many derivations are seen.
Besides the names, many derivations are seen.

sen.j: 何かをしようとするが失敗し、悔しがって去って行くという内容が多い。
sen.e: In many cases the story is that the giant tries to do something but fails and go away to his chagrin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In many cases, the story is that the giant tries to do something but fails and goes away, to his chagrin.
sen.cmt: カンマを挿入しました。go→goes と修正しました。
sen.e: In many cases, the story is that the giant tries to do something but fails and goes away, to his chagrin.

sen.j: 通常は目の数は言及されず山を運んだりすることから相当の巨体であるとされる。
sen.e: Usually the number of the eyes is not mentioned, and it is imagined that Daidarabocchi has a gigantic body because he carries the mountains.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Usually the number of the eyes is not mentioned, and it is imagined that Daidarabocchi has a gigantic body because he carries mountains.
Usually the number of the eyes is not mentioned, and it is imagined that Daidarabocchi has a gigantic body because he carries mountains.

sen.j: 一つ目とされる場合は、目の数に言及されない場合に比較して概ね小型で身長10m程度である場合が多い。
sen.e: The giant with single eye is often about ten meters tall, which is relatively smaller than the giant in the case that the number of eyes is not mentioned.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The giant with single eye is often about 10m tall, which is relatively smaller than the giant in the case that the number of eyes is not mentioned.
sen.cmt: ten meters→10m と修正しました。
sen.e: The giant with single eye is often about 10m tall, which is relatively smaller than the giant in the case that the number of eyes is not mentioned.

sen.j: 足の数は何かを「一跨ぎ」する表現が多いことから二本足と考えられる。
sen.e: The number of his legs is considered two because in the legend the giant 'steps over' something in one stride.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The number of his legs is considered to be two, because the giant 'steps over' something in one stride in the legend.
sen.cmt: to be, カンマを挿入しました。文の流れをよりスムースにしました。
sen.e: The number of his legs is considered to be two, because the giant 'steps over' something in one stride in the legend.

sen.j: 一つ目とされる場合は1本足とされることが多く、一つ目入道あるいは一つ目小僧と習合したものと考えられる。
sen.e: The giant with single eye often has only one leg, which is considered the synretization with Hitotsumenyudo (one-eyed monster) or Hitosumekozo (one-eyed goblin).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The giant with single eye often has only one leg, which is considered as the syncretization with Hitotsumenyudo (one-eyed monster) or Hitosumekozo (one-eyed goblin).
The giant with single eye often has only one leg, which is considered as the syncretization with Hitotsumenyudo (one-eyed monster) or Hitosumekozo (one-eyed goblin).

tit.e: Fudoki (description of regional climate, culture, etc.)
Fudoki (description of regional climate, culture, etc.)
tit.cmt: スペースの修正をしました。
tit.e: Fudoki (description of regional climate, culture, etc.)
Hitachi no kuni fudoki (fudoki of Hitachi Province)
Hitachi no kuni fudoki (fudoki of Hitachi Province)
Hitachi no kuni fudoki (fudoki of Hitachi Province)

sen.j: 『常陸国風土記』那賀略記には、次の記述がある。
sen.e: There is a following description in "Hitachi no kuni fudoki" Naga Ryakki.
There is the following description in "Hitachi no kuni fudoki" Naga Ryakki.
There is the following description in "Hitachi no kuni fudoki" Naga Ryakki.

sen.j: 平津の駅家（うまや）の西12里（古代には12里＝60町≒6.5km）に、大櫛（おおぐし）という岡がある。
sen.e: There is a hill called Ogushi about 6.5 kilometer west of umaya (facilities for providing houses, food etc.) in Hiratsu.
There is a hill called Ogushi, about 6.5 km west of umaya (facilities for providing houses, food etc.) in Hiratsu.
sen.cmt: kilometer→km,カンマを挿入しました。
sen.e: There is a hill called Ogushi, about 6.5 km west of umaya (facilities for providing houses, food etc.) in Hiratsu.

sen.j: 大昔、巨人がおり、岡の上にいながら手が海まで届き蜃（大ハマグリ）をさらうほどであった。
sen.e: Long time ago, there was a giant and he was so big that his arms were long enough to reach the sea and grab the huge hamaguri clams while sitting on the hill.
Long ago, there was a giant, and he was so big that his arms reached the sea and grabbed the huge hamaguri clams while he was on a hill.
sen.cmt: Long ago と修正し、カンマを挿入し、文半ばより文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: Long ago, there was a giant, and he was so big that his arms reached the sea and grabbed the huge hamaguri clams while he was on a hill.

sen.j: 巨人の食べた貝は、積もって岡になった（貝塚のこと）。
sen.e: The seashells after which the giant had eaten accumulated into the hill (that is, a shell mounds).
The seashells after which the giant had eaten piled up to became a hill (that is, a shell mounds).
sen.cmt: accumulated into the hill→piled up to became a hill,mounds→mound と修正しました。
sen.e: The seashells after which the giant had eaten piled up to became a hill (that is, a shell mounds).

sen.j: 当時は大朽（おおくち）といったが、今は大櫛の岡という。
sen.e: At that time the place was called Okuchi, but it is called the hill of Okushi now.
At that time the hill was called Okuchi, but it is now called the hill of Ogushi.
sen.cmt: place→hill,now の位置を変更してよりスムースにしました。Okushi→Ogushi と修正しました。
sen.e: At that time the hill was called Okuchi, but it is now called the hill of Ogushi.

sen.j: 巨人の足跡は長さ40歩余、幅20歩余で、小便が穿った穴は直径20歩余であった
sen.e: The giant's footstep was 40 steps or more in length, 20 steps or more in width, and the hole dug by the giant's urine was 20 steps or more in diameter.
The giant's footprint was 72 m or more in length, 36 m or more in width, and the hole, dug by the giant's urine was 36 m or more in diameter.
sen.cmt: footstep→footprint,カンマを挿入しました。”40歩余り”、”20歩余り”をそれぞれ変更しました。（1歩6尺＝約1.8ｍとして）
sen.e: The giant's footprint was 72 m or more in length, 36 m or more in width, and the hole, dug by the giant's urine was 36 m or more in diameter.

tit.e: Harima no kuni fudoki (fudoki of Harima Province)
Harima no kuni fudoki (fudoki of Harima Province)
Harima no kuni fudoki (fudoki of Harima Province)

sen.j: 『播磨国風土記』の託賀郡（多可郡）の条には次のとおり同地の天が高いといい足跡が数多の沼になった大人（おおひと）伝説が記されている。
sen.e: In Taka County section of "Harima fudoki "there is a description of the legend about the giant that the sky in the county was high and the footprints became many lakes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Taka County section of "Harima fudoki,"there is a description of the legend about the giant that the sky in the county was high and the footprints became many lakes.
sen.cmt: カンマを挿入しました。
sen.e: In Taka County section of "Harima fudoki,"there is a description of the legend about the giant that the sky in the county was high and the footprints became many lakes.

sen.j: 『常陸国風土記』の伝説と同種であると考えられている。
sen.e: It is considered that this legend belongs to the same lineage as "Hitachi no kuni fudoki."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is considered that this legend is the same kind of "Hitachi no kuni fudoki."
sen.cmt: ”同種である”という部分を修正しました。
sen.e: It is considered that this legend is the same kind of "Hitachi no kuni fudoki."

sen.j: 同郡では製銅が盛んだったようで、金属生産と巨人という出雲国の例との共通点もみられる。
sen.e: It seems that in Taka County copper was produced actively, and the fact is similar to the one in Izumo Province as the two places produced metal and had the legend of the giant.
It seems that copper was produced actively in Taka County, and the fact is similar to the one in Izumo Province as the two places produced metal and had the legend of the giant.
sen.cmt: オーダーを修正しました。
sen.e: It seems that copper was produced actively in Taka County, and the fact is similar to the one in Izumo Province as the two places produced metal and had the legend of the giant.

sen.j: 託賀郡には昔、巨人がいて、いつも屈んで歩いていた。
sen.e: In Taka County there was a giant and he was always bending down in walking.
In Taka County long ago, there was a giant and he was always bending down in walking.
In Taka County long ago, there was a giant and he was always bending down in walking.

sen.j: 南の海、北の海、東を巡ってこの地にやって来て「他の地は（天が）低くていつも屈んで歩いていた。
sen.e: Touring the sea in the south, the sea in the north and east, the giant came to the county, and said, 'In other places the sky was so low that I always had to bend down to walk.
Touring the sea in the south, the sea in the north and the east, the giant came to this county, and said, "In other places the sky was so low that I always had to bend down to walk.
sen.cmt: the を挿入しました。the→this,クォートを修正しました。
sen.e: Touring the sea in the south, the sea in the north and the east, the giant came to this county, and said, "In other places the sky was so low that I always had to bend down to walk.

sen.j: この地は高くてまっすぐ立って歩ける」と言った。
sen.e: But this place the sky is high enough to walk with my back straightened up.,' the giant said.
But this place the sky is high enough to walk with my back straightened up."
sen.cmt: クォートを修正しました。カンマ、the giant said を削除しました。
sen.e: But this place the sky is high enough to walk with my back straightened up."

sen.j: だからこの地を託賀（たか＝高）郡という。
sen.e: That is why this place came to be called Taka (=high) County.
sen.cmt: 日本語が2文になっていたのでセルを分割しました。
sen.e: That is why this place came to be called Taka (=high) County.
That is why this place came to be called Taka (=high) County.

sen.j: 巨人の足跡は数々の沼になった。
sen.e: The footprints of the giant became a number of ponds.
The footprints of the giant became a number of marshes.
The footprints of the giant became a number of marshes.

tit.cmt: place-name→place names と修正しました。

sen.j: 柳田國男の著書『妖怪談義』にて相模原市大沼に調査に行ったとの記述あり。
sen.e: In the book titled "Yokai Dangi (lecture about specters), there is a description that he went to Onuma, Sagamihara City to conduct field research.
In the book of Kunio YANAGITA titled "Yokai Dangi "(lecture about specters), there is a description that he went to Onuma, Sagamihara City for his research.
sen.cmt: ”柳田國男の”を挿入、クォーツを修正しました。to conduct field research の部分を修正しました。（彼の文献のための調査と理解し）
sen.e: In the book of Kunio YANAGITA titled "Yokai Dangi "(lecture about specters), there is a description that he went to Onuma, Sagamihara City for his research.

sen.j: その地ではダイダラボッチの伝説は無かったと落胆しているが、ダイダラボッチ伝説があるのは北に5kmほどずれた鹿沼であった。
sen.e: He was disappointed to know that the place did not have the legend of Daidarabocchi, but it was Kanuma located about five kilometer north of Onuma that had the legend.
He was disappointed at that the place did not have the legend of Daidarabocchi, but it was Kanuma located about 5 km north of Onuma that had the legend.
sen.cmt: to know→at,five kilometer→5 km と修正しました。
sen.e: He was disappointed at that the place did not have the legend of Daidarabocchi, but it was Kanuma located about 5 km north of Onuma that had the legend.

sen.j: 土地によって伝承される内容が異なり、作ったとされる山や沼も異なる。
sen.e: The content of the legend is different, depending on the place, and the alleged mountains and lakes made by Daidarabocchi are also different.
The contents of the legend vary according to the locals, and the alleged mountains and marshes made by Daidarabocchi are also different.
sen.cmt: 文脈より最初の部分を修正しました。lakes→marshes,スペースの修正をしました。
sen.e: The contents of the legend vary according to the locals, and the alleged mountains and marshes made by Daidarabocchi are also different.

sen.j: 東日本の大きな火山にまつわる伝承が比較的多い。
sen.e: There are relatively many legends related to big volcanoes in eastern Japan.
There are relatively many legends related to big volcanoes in eastern Japan.
There are relatively many legends related to big volcanoes in eastern Japan.

sen.j: 山を作る・運ぶ
sen.e: Building and carrying mountains
Building and carrying mountains
Building and carrying mountains

sen.j: 富士山を作るため、甲州の土をとって土盛りした。
sen.e: In order to build Mt. Fuji, Daidarabocchi used the soil he dug from Koshu.
In order to build Mt. Fuji, Daidarabocchi piled up the soil he dug from Koshu.
sen.cmt: ”土盛りした”という部分を補いました。
sen.e: In order to build Mt. Fuji, Daidarabocchi piled up the soil he dug from Koshu.

sen.j: そのため甲州は盆地になった。
sen.e: Because of this, Koshu became a basin.
Because of this, Koshu became a basin.
Because of this, Koshu became a basin.

sen.j: 上州の榛名富士を土盛りして作った。
sen.e: He used the soil from Joshu to build Mt. Haruna Fuji.
He built Mt. Haruna Fuji of Joshu by piling soil.
sen.cmt: 文脈より、”上州にある榛名富士”と理解し、修正しました。
sen.e: He built Mt. Haruna Fuji of Joshu by piling soil.

sen.j: 掘った後は榛名湖となった。
sen.e: The place where he had taken the soil became Harunako Lake.
The place where he had taken the soil became Harunako Lake.
The place where he had taken the soil became Harunako Lake.

sen.j: 榛名富士が富士山より低いのは、もう少し土を運ぼうとしたが夜が明け、途中でやめたためである。
sen.e: Mt. Haruna Fuji is lower than Mt. Fuji is because Daidarabocchi tried to carry a little more soil but gave up in the course at the breaking of the dawn.
Mt. Haruna Fuji is lower than Mt. Fuji, because Daidarabocchi tried to carry a little more soil but gave up in the course at the breaking of the dawn.
sen.cmt: is を削除しし、カンマを挿入しました。
sen.e: Mt. Haruna Fuji is lower than Mt. Fuji, because Daidarabocchi tried to carry a little more soil but gave up in the course at the breaking of the dawn.

sen.j: 浅間山が、自分より背の高い妹の富士山に嫉妬し、土を自分にわけろといった。
sen.e: Mt. Asama felt jealous of younger sister Mt. Fuji which is higher than Mt. Asama and demanded that Mt. Fuji share its soil.
Mt. Asama felt jealous of younger sister Mt. Fuji which was higher than itself, and demanded Mt. Fuji to share its soil.
sen.cmt: is→was,Mt. Asama→itself,, that を削除し、to を挿入しました。
sen.e: Mt. Asama felt jealous of younger sister Mt. Fuji which was higher than itself, and demanded Mt. Fuji to share its soil.

sen.j: 富士山は了解し、だいだらぼっちが自分の前掛けで土を運んだ。
sen.e: Mt. Fuji agreed, and Daidarabocchi carried the soil in his apron.
Mt. Fuji agreed, and Daidarabocchi carried the soil in his apron.
Mt. Fuji agreed, and Daidarabocchi carried the soil in his apron.

sen.j: しかし浅間山は土の量が足りないと怒り、彼を叩いた。
sen.e: However, Mt. Asama became angry saying that the amount of soil was not enough, and hit the giant.
However, Mt. Asama became angry saying that the amount of soil was not enough, and hit the giant.
However, Mt. Asama became angry saying that the amount of soil was not enough, and hit the giant.

sen.j: その際にこぼれた土が前掛山となった。
sen.e: The spilled soil at the moment became Mt. Maekake.
The spilled soil at the moment became Mt. Maekake.
The spilled soil at the moment became Mt. Maekake.

sen.j: 怒りだした浅間山はついに噴火してしまった。
sen.e: The angry Mt. Asama erupted at last.
The angry Mt. Asama erupted at last.
The angry Mt. Asama erupted at last.

sen.j: 西の富士、東の筑波と呼ばれる関東の名山の重さを量ろうとし天秤棒に2つの山を結わえつけ持ち上げると、筑波山のほうは持ち上がったが富士山は持ち上がらない。
sen.e: One day, trying to compare the weight of so called beautiful mountains Mt. Fuji in the west and Mt. Tsukuba in the east, Daidarabocchi tied the ropes around the two mountains and connected the ropes to each end of the yoke and lifted it, and he could lift Mt. Tsukuba but not Mt. Fuji,

One day, trying to compare the weights of so called beautiful mountains Mt. Fuji in the west and Mt. Tsukuba in the east, Daidarabocchi tied the ropes the two mountains to a yoke and lifted it, and Mt. Tsukuba was lifted but not Mt. Fuji.
sen.cmt: weight→weights,文脈に応じて後半部分を修正しました。ピリオドを修正しました。
sen.e: One day, trying to compare the weights of so called beautiful mountains Mt. Fuji in the west and Mt. Tsukuba in the east, Daidarabocchi tied the ropes the two mountains to a yoke and lifted it, and Mt. Tsukuba was lifted but not Mt. Fuji.

sen.j: そのうちに結わえていたつるが切れ、筑波山が地上に落ちてしまった。
sen.e: And in n the course, however, the rope tied to Mt. Tsukuba broke and the mountain fell to the ground.
And in the course, however, the rope tied to two mountains broke and Mt. Tsukuba fell to the ground.
sen.cmt: n を削除しました。the rope 以降を文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: And in the course, however, the rope tied to two mountains broke and Mt. Tsukuba fell to the ground.

sen.j: その衝撃でもともと1つの峰だった筑波山は、2峰になってしまったという。
sen.e: The legend has it that because of the impact at the moment, the original single peak of Mt. Tsukuba was split into two.
It is said that, the originally single peak Mt. Tsukuba was split into two peaks by the impact,
sen.cmt: The legend has it→It is said, オーダー等を修正してより流れをスムースにしました。
sen.e: It is said that, the originally single peak Mt. Tsukuba was split into two peaks by the impact,

sen.j: 足あと・手のあとを残す
sen.e: Leaving footprints and handprints
Leaving footprints and handprints
Leaving footprints and handprints

sen.j: 上州の赤城山に腰掛けて踏ん張ったときに窪んで出来た足跡が水たまりになった。
sen.e: The foot-print that Daidarabocchi made when he sat on M. Akagi in Joshu to struggle to hold on became a puddle.
The footprint, that Daidarabocchi made when he sat on M. Akagi in Joshu and straddled became a puddle.
sen.cmt: カンマを挿入しました。foot-print→footprint,to struggle to hold on→and straddled と修正しました。
sen.e: The footprint, that Daidarabocchi made when he sat on Mt. Akagi in Joshu and straddled became a puddle.

sen.j: 木部の赤沼がそれである。
sen.e: The puddle is Akanuma in Kibe.
The puddle is Akanuma in Kibe.
The puddle is Akanuma in Kibe.

sen.j: 長野県大町市北部の青木湖、中綱湖、木崎湖の仁科三湖はダイダラボッチの足あとである。
sen.e: The Nishina Sanko (Nishina three lakes) that consist of Aokiko Lake, Nakatsunako Lake and Kizakiko Lake in the north of Omachi City of Nagano Prefecture are the foot-prints of Daidarabocchi.
The Nishina Sanko (Nishina three lakes) that consist of Aokiko Lake, Nakatsunako Lake and Kizakiko Lake in the north of Omachi City of Nagano Prefecture are the footprints of Daidarabocchi.
sen.cmt: スペースの修正をしました。foot-prints→footprints と修正しました。
sen.e: The Nishina Sanko (Nishina three lakes) that consist of Aokiko Lake, Nakatsunako Lake and Kizakiko Lake in the north of Omachi City of Nagano Prefecture are the footprints of Daidarabocchi.

sen.j: 茨城県水戸市中央部の千波湖は、かなり大きいがダイダラボッチ（この地方ではダイダラボウ）の足跡である。
sen.e: Senbako Lake located in the center of Mito City, Ibaraki Prefecture, is the foot-print of Daidarabocchi (locally called Daidarabo), though it is rather big.
Senbako Lake located in the center of Mito City, Ibaraki Prefecture, is a footprint of Daidarabocchi (locally called Daidarabo), though it is rather big.
sen.cmt: the foot-print→a footprint と修正しました。
sen.e: Senbako Lake located in the center of Mito City, Ibaraki Prefecture, is a footprint of Daidarabocchi (locally called Daidarabo), though it is rather big.

sen.j: 遠州の山奥に住んでいた巨人ダイダラボッチが、子どもたちを手にのせて歩いている時に、腰くらいの高さの山をまたいだ拍子に子どもたちを手から投げ出してしまった。
sen.e: When Daidarabocchi who lived deep in the mountains in Enshu was carrying his children on his hand, he accidentally threw away the children at the moment of trying to step over the mountain which was about as high as his waist.

When Daidarabocchi who lived deep in the mountains in Enshu was walking with children on his hand, he accidentally threw away the children at the moment of trying to step over the mountain which was about as high as his waist.
sen.cmt: carrying→walking with, his を削除しました。（”彼の”とは記述していないため）
sen.e: When Daidarabocchi who lived deep in the mountains in Enshu was walking with children on his hand, he accidentally threw away the children at the moment of trying to step over the mountain which was about as high as his waist.

sen.j: びっくりした子どもたちとダイダラボッチは泣き出してしまい、手をついてできた窪みに涙が流れ込んで浜名湖となった。
sen.e: Surprised Daidarabocchi and his children began to cry, and their tears poured into the hand-print the giant made on the ground the moment he fell to the ground, resulting in Hamanako Lake.
Surprised Daidarabocchi and children began to cry, and their tears poured into the handprint which the giant made when he fell to the ground, resulting in Hamanako Lake.
sen.cmt: his を削除しました。hand-print→handprint,which を挿入しました。on the ground the moment →when と修正しました。
sen.e: Surprised Daidarabocchi and children began to cry, and their tears poured into the handprint which the giant made when he fell to the ground, resulting in Hamanako Lake.

sen.j: 現在、東京都世田谷区にある地名「代田」（だいた）やさいたま市の「太田窪」（だいたくぼ）はダイタラボッチの足跡である。
sen.e: The place-names of 'Daita' in Setagaya Ward, Tokyo and 'Daitakubo' in Saitama City indicate that they are the footprints of Daidarabocchi.
Today, the place names of 'Daita' in Setagaya Ward, Tokyo Metropolis and 'Daitakubo' in Saitama City are the footprints of Daidarabocchi.
sen.cmt: place-names→place names,Today, Metropolis を挿入しました。indicate that they を削除しました。
sen.e: Today, the place names of 'Daita' in Setagaya Ward, Tokyo Metropolis and 'Daitakubo' in Saitama City are the footprints of Daidarabocchi.

sen.j: 静岡市のだいらぼう山頂には全長150mほどの窪みがある。
sen.e: On the peak area of Mt. Daidarabo in Shizuoka City there is a dented part which is about 150 meter in length.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At the peak of Mt. Daidarabo in Shizuoka City, there is a dent which is about 150 m in length.
sen.cmt: On→At,meter→m,dented part→dent と修正し、area, を削除しました。カンマを挿入しました。
sen.e: At the peak of Mt. Daidarabo in Shizuoka City, there is a dent which is about 150 m in length.

sen.j: ダイダラボッチが左足を置いた跡と伝えられている。
sen.e: It is believed to be a footprint made by the left foot of Daidarabocchi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is believed to be a footprint made by the left foot of Daidarabocchi.
It is believed to be a footprint made by the left foot of Daidarabocchi.

sen.j: 琵琶湖から富士山へ土を運ぶ途中に遺したものであるという。
sen.e: It is said that it was made while the giant was carrying the soil from Biwako Lake to Mt. Fuji.
It is said that it was left while the giant was carrying the soil from Biwako Lake to Mt. Fuji.
It is said that it was left while the giant was carrying the soil from Biwako Lake to Mt. Fuji.

sen.j: 相模原市の伝説ではデイラボッチと呼ばれ、富士山を持ち上げ違う場所に運ぶ途中、疲れたので、富士山に乗っかり休んだ。
sen.e: In the legend of Sagamihara City the giant is called Deidarabocchi, and while he was carrying Mt. Fuji to a different place, he took a rest sitting on Mt. Fuji because he was tired.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the legend of Sagamihara City the giant is called Deidarabocchi, and while he was carrying Mt. Fuji to a different place, he became tired then sat on Mt. Fuji and rested.
sen.cmt: he took 以降をよりスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: In the legend of Sagamihara City the giant is called Deidarabocchi, and while he was carrying Mt. Fuji to a different place, he became tired then sat on Mt. Fuji and rested.

sen.j: そこにまた根が生えてしまいもちあげようとするが、持ち上がらずそのときふんばった所が今の鹿沼であるという。
sen.e: Then roots started to grow from the mountain, and he stood firm to try to lift the mountain, and this is how the present Kanuma was made.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then roots started to grow from the mountain, and he straddled to lift the mountain, and this is how the present Kanuma was made.
sen.cmt: stood firm→straddled と修正しました。
sen.e: Then roots started to grow from the mountain, and he straddled to lift the mountain, and this is how the present Kanuma was made.

sen.j: 小便をしようと飯野山(香川県中部)に足をかけた際に山頂付近に足跡が付いた。
sen.e: Another footprints were made when the giant put his feet on the peak area of Mt. Ino (in central area in Kagawa Prefecture) to discharge his urine.
Other footprints were left when the giant put his feet on the peak area of Mt. Ino (in central area in Kagawa Prefecture) to discharge his urine.
Other footprints were left when the giant put his feet on the peak area of Mt. Ino (in central area in Kagawa Prefecture) to discharge his urine.

sen.j: (現在もその跡であるという伝説の足跡が残っているが非常に小さい。）
sen.e: (The footprints allegedly made by the giant still remain now, but they are very small.)
(The footprints allegedly made by the giant still remain now, but they are very small.)
(The footprints allegedly made by the giant still remain now, but they are very small.)

sen.j: なお、その小便の際に出来たのが大束川といわれる。
sen.e: In addition it is said that it is when the giant discharged his urine that Daisokugawa River was made.
In addition, it is said that Daisoku-gawa River was made when the giant discharged his urine.
sen.cmt: カンマを挿入しました。Daisaokugawa River→Daisoku-gawa River,文をスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: In addition, it is said that Daisoku-gawa River was made when the giant discharged his urine.

sen.j: 休む・洗う
sen.e: Rest and Wash
Rest and Wash
Rest and Wash

sen.j: 榛名山に腰掛けて、利根川で脛を洗った（ふんどしを洗ったという説もある）。
sen.e: The giant washed his shins in Tonegawa River. (He washed his loincloth in another story.)
The giant washed his shins in Tone-gawa River (He washed his loincloth in a theory.)
sen.cmt: Tonegawa river→Tone-gawa River,another story→a theory と修正し、不要なピリオドを削除しました。
sen.e: The giant washed his shins in Tone-gawa River (He washed his loincloth in a theory.)

sen.j: 羽黒山 (栃木県)には人間がまだ誕生しない大昔、でいだらぼっちが羽黒山に腰掛けて鬼怒川で足を洗ったという言い伝えがある。
sen.e: There is a legend that long before human beings appeared, Deidarabocchi sat down on Mt. Haguro (in Tochigi Prefecture) and took a rest.
There is a legend that long before human beings appeared, Deidarabocchi sat down on Mt. Haguro (in Tochigi Prefecture) and washed his legs in Kinu-gawa River.
sen.cmt: took a rest を削除し、”鬼怒川で足を洗った”という部分を補いました。
sen.e: There is a legend that long before human beings appeared, Deidarabocchi sat down on Mt. Haguro (in Tochigi Prefecture) and washed his legs in Kinu-gawa River.

sen.j: 長野県塩尻市の八ヶ岳中信高原国定公園はダイダラボッチが腰を下ろして一休みした場所であるという。
sen.e: It is believed that Yatsugatake Chushin highlands Quasi-National Park in Shiojiri City, Nagano Prefecture is where Daidarabocchi sat down and took a rest.
It is believed that Yatsugatake Chushin highlands Quasi-National Park in Shiojiri City, Nagano Prefecture is where Daidarabocchi sat down and took a rest.
It is believed that Yatsugatake Chushin highlands Quasi-National Park in Shiojiri City, Nagano Prefecture is where Daidarabocchi sat down and took a rest.

sen.j: 人間を助ける
sen.e: Helping human beings
Helping human beings
Helping human beings

sen.j: 秋田県の横手盆地が湖であったので鳥の海の干拓を行った際、だいだらぼっちが現れて水をかき、泥を掬ったため工事がはかどった。
sen.e: Yokote Basin in Akita Prefecture was once a lake called Torinoumi, and when the lake was reclaimed, Daidarabocchi appeared and drained the water and shoveled the mud, by which the reclamation made much progress.

Yokote Basin in Akita Prefecture was once a lake called Torinoumi, and when the lake was reclaimed, Daidarabocchi appeared and drained the water and shoveled the mud, by which the reclamation made much progress.

Yokote Basin in Akita Prefecture was once a lake called Torinoumi, and when the lake was reclaimed, Daidarabocchi appeared and drained the water and shoveled the mud, by which the reclamation made much progress.

sen.j: このだいだらぼっちは秋田市の太平山三吉神社の化身と考えられる。
sen.e: This Daidarabocchi is considered the incarnation of Taiheizan-miyoshi Jinja Shrine.
This Daidarabocchi is considered as the incarnation of Miyoshi-jinja Shrine on Mt. Taihei.
sen.cmt: as を挿入しました。Taiheizan-miyoshi Jinja Shrine→Miyoshi-jinja Shrine on Mt. Taihei （用語集の訳とは異なりますが、太平山は標高1000ｍを超える山であるのを確認しました）
sen.e: This Daidarabocchi is considered as the incarnation of Miyoshi-jinja Shrine on Mt. Taihei.

sen.j: 愛知県東海市の南側に加木屋町陀々法師（だだほうし）という地名があり、ダイダラボッチが歩いて移動する際に出来た足跡が池になったとして伝説が残っている。
sen.e: There is a place-name called Dadahoshi, Kagiyamachi Town in southern area of Tokai City, Aichi Prefecture, where the legend still remains that the footprints of Daidarabocchi became ponds when the giant was walking to move.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There is a place name called Dadahoshi, Kagiyamachi Town in southern area of Tokai City, Aichi Prefecture, where the legend still remains that the footprints of Daidarabocchi became ponds when the giant was moving on foot.
sen.cmt: place-name→place name, walking to move→moving on foot と修正しました。
sen.e: There is a place name called Dadahoshi, Kagiyamachi Town in southern area of Tokai City, Aichi Prefecture, where the legend still remains that the footprints of Daidarabocchi became ponds when the giant was moving on foot.

sen.j: 名古屋鉄道八幡新田駅西側にあったが頃に埋め立てられて現在はその形跡ない。
sen.e: The ponds used to be in western side of Yawatashinden Station of Nagoya Railroad, but the ponds were reclaimed and the traces does not exist now.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The ponds used to be in the west side of Yawata Shinden Station of Nagoya Railroad, but the ponds were reclaimed and the trace does not exist now.
sen.cmt: Yawatashinden→Yawata-Shinden （用語集の登録と異なりますが、ウェブ上ではこれが主であったためこちらに修正しました）western→the west,traces→trace と修正しました。
sen.e: The ponds used to be in the west side of Yawata Shinden Station of Nagoya Railroad, but the ponds were reclaimed and the trace does not exist now.
